channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain cover and surrounding tarmac gone creating big hole, 22nd December
item.description:
Next to bus shelter the drain cover has dropped due to weight of bus and lorries, creating a big hole, loose stones are thrown up when traffic goes by and puddles form making it a splash area this work was addressed weeks ago badly now a hole has reappeared, 50 yards down from the stop another hole has formed ouside 1st mobility shop these holes could damage your buses
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Welling High Street, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycle Locked to Fence for Several Months, 22nd December
item.description:
Black bicycle has been locked to the Shoulder of Mutton Fence since at least September. Location: Fence near entrance to Bellegrove Close Enquiries have drawn a blank with local residents and shops unaware as to its ownership. I have observed it throughout this period and at various times of day between 7am-1am. It has not moved. An angle grinder or similar tool will be required to remove the lock. This bicycle is a candidate for the ReUse shop although first check for any security marking to identify ownership.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellegrove Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags are not being collected., 22nd December
item.description:
Our recycling bags have been awaiting collection for 5 days now. There is a schedule collection twice a day on this street, Luke Street, EC2A4PY. not sure why they are being missed? Please forward and advise?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Luke Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insufficient bin space - environmental health issue, 22nd December
item.description:
Large communal metal bins on our street regularly overflow before collection day. Residents then leave rubbish bags on the ground beside the bins. This is attracting foxes, which are tearing open bags and spreading litter across the street. Foxes also foul directly outside my front door. This is an ongoing waste management and environmental health issue. We need increased bin capacity or more frequent collections to deter the foxes, plus enforcement to stop ground dumping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lorrimore Square, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
